gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਹ੍ਵੈਹੈਂ ਬੇਮੁਖ ਬਿਨਾ ਧਨ ॥ ਤਬ ਚੜਿਹੈਂ ਸਿਖਨ ਕਹ ਮਾਂਗਨ ॥
transliteration: Jab Hvaihain Bemoukh Binaa Dhan|| Tab Chadihain Sikhan Kah Maanad||
translation: Those impertinent persons will he without money, they will beg for it form the Sikhs.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਜੇ ਸਿਖ ਤਿਨੈ ਧਨ ਦੈਹੈਂ ॥ ਲੂਟ ਮਲੇਛ ਤਿਨੂ ਕੌ ਲੈਹੈਂ ॥੧੧॥
transliteration: Je Je Sikh Tinai Dhan Daihain|| Loot Malechh Tinoo Kau Laihain||11||
translation: And those Sikhs, who will give them money, their houses will be plundered by the Malechhas (barbarians).11.

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਹੁੲਿ ਹੈ ਤਿਨ ਦਰਬ ਬਿਨਾਸਾ ॥ ਤਬ ਧਰਿਹੈ ਨਿਜ ਗੁਰ ਕੀ ਅਾਸਾ ॥
transliteration: Jab Hue Hai Tin Darab Binaasaa|| Tab Dharihai Nij Gur Koo Aasaa||
translation: When their wealth will be destroyed, then they will keep hopes on their Guru.

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਤੇ ਗੁਰ ਦਰਸਨ ਕੌ ਅੈਹੈਂ ॥ ਤਬ ਤਿਨ ਕੋ ਗੁਰ ਮੁਖ ਨ ਲਗੈਹੈਂ ॥੧੨॥
transliteration: Jab Te Gur Darsan Kau Aihain|| Tab Tin Ko Gur Mouch Na Lagadhain||12||
translation: They will all come then to have a sight of the Guru, but the Guru will not receive them.12.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਦਾ ਬਿਨਾ ਜੈਹੈਂ ਤਬ ਧਾਮੰ ॥ ਸਰਿਹੈ ਕੋੲੀ ਨ ਤਿਨ ਕੋ ਕਾਮੰ ॥
transliteration: Bidaa Binaa Jaihain Tab Dhaamannd|| Sarihai Ko( i)  Na Tin Ko Kaamannd||
translation: Then without seeking the permission of the Guru, they will return to their homes, therefore none of their work will be fruitful.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਦਰ ਢੋੲੀ ਨ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਪੁਰ ਵਾਸਾ ॥ ਦੁਹੂੰ ਠੳੁਰ ਤੇ ਰਹੇ ਨਿਰਾਸਾ ॥੧੩॥
transliteration: Gur Dar Dhooo Na Prabh Pur Vaasaa|| Duhoon Thaur Te Rahe Niraasaa||13||
translation: He, who doth not get the refuge at the house of the Guru, he doth not get an abode in the Court of the Lord. He remains disappointed at both the places, in this world as well as the next world.13.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਜੇ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਨਨ ਰਤ ਹ੍ਵੈਹੈਂ ॥ ਤਿਨ ਕੋ ਕਸਟ ਨ ਦੇਖਨ ਪੈਹੈਂ ॥
transliteration: Je Je Gur Charnan Rat Hvaihain|| Tin Ko Kast Na Dekhan Padhhain||
translation: Those, who are the devotees of Guru’s feet, the sufferings cannot touch them.

gurmukhi: ਰਿਧ ਸਿਧ ਤਿਨ ਕੇ ਗ੍ਹਿ ਮਾਹੀਂ ॥ ਪਾਪ ਤਾਪ ਛ੍ਵੈ ਸਕੈ ਨ ਛਾਹੀਂ ॥੧੪॥
transliteration: Ridh Sidh Tin Ke Grih Maahoon|| Paap Taap Chhvai Sakai Na Chhaadoon||14||
translation: The wealth and prosperity always abide in their house and the sins and ailments cannot even come near their shadow.14.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਹ ਮਲੇਛ ਛ੍ਵੈਹੈ ਨਹੀਂ ਛਾਹਾਂ ॥ ਅਸਟ ਸਿਧ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਹੈ ਘਰਿ ਮਾਹਾਂ ॥
transliteration: Tih Malechh Chhvaihai Nahoon Chhaadaan|| Ast Sidh Hvai Hai Ghar(i) Maahaan||
translation: The malechha (barbarian) cannot touch their shadwow, the eight miraculous powers in their house.

gurmukhi: ਹਾਸ ਕਰਤ ਜੋ ੳੁਦਮ ੳੁਠੈਹੈਂ ॥ ਨਵੋ ਨਿਧਿ ਤਿਨ ਕੇ ਘਰਿ ਅੈਹੈਂ ॥੧੫॥
transliteration: Haas Karat Jo Udam Outhaihain|| Navo Nidh(i) Tin Ke Ghar(i) Aihain||15||
translation: Even if they endeavour to reap gain by way of fun, the nine treasures come to their abode by themselves.15.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਰਜਾ ਬੇਗ ਹੁਤੋ ਤਿਹ ਨਾਮੰ ॥ ਜਿਨ ਢਾਹੇ ਬੇਮੁਖਨ ਕੇ ਧਾਮੰ ॥
transliteration: Mirjaa Beg Houto Tih Naamannd|| Jin Dhaahe Bemoukhan Ke Dhaamannd||
translation: Mirza Beg was the name of the officer, who demolished the houses of the apostates.

gurmukhi: ਸਬ ਸਨਮੁਖ ਗੁਰ ਅਾਪ ਬਚਾੲੇ ॥ ਤਿਨ ਕੇ ਬਾਰ ਨ ਬਾਂਕਨ ਪਾੲੇ ॥੧੬॥
transliteration: Sabsanmoukh Guraap Bachaae|| Tin Ke Baar Na Baankan Paae||16||
translation: Those who remained faithful, were protected by the Guru, not even a little harm was done to them.16.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤ ਅੳੁਰੰਗ ਜੀਅ ਅਧਿਕ ਰਿਸਾਯੋ ॥ ਚਾਰ ਅਹਦੀਯਨ ਅੳੁਰ ਪਠਾਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Out Auran Jooa Adhik Risaayo|| Chaar Ahdooyan Aur Pathaayo||
translation: There the son of Aurangzeb grew most angry, he sent four other officers.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਬੇਮੁਖ ਤਾਂ ਤੇ ਬਚਿ ਅਾੲੇ ॥ ਤਿਨ ਕੇ ਗ੍ਹਿ ਪੁਨਿ ੲਿਨੈ ਗਿਰਾੲੇ ॥੧੭॥
transliteration: Je Bemoukh Taan Te Bach(i) Aae|| Tin Ke Grih Poun(i) Inai Giraae||17||
translation: Those apostates who had escaped (the punishment) earlier, there hoses were demolished by the officers. 17.
